snippet: The faculty of New York University is conducting a no-confidence vote on John Sexton, the university’s president, whom some consider a hero and others an autocrat.
abstract: Faculty of New York University's Arts and Science school is set to begin five-day no-confidence vote on university president John Sexton, whose ambitious efforts to expand university and raise money have led some to view him as a hero and others as an autocrat; vote may serve as important referendum on direction of American higher education and role of university leaders.
lead_paragraph: The faculty of New York University is conducting a no-confidence vote on John Sexton, the university’s president, whom some consider a hero and others an autocrat.

headline.seo: N.Y.U.’s Global Leader Is Tested by Faculty at Home
headline.main: N.Y.U.’s Global Leader Is Tested by Faculty at Home
